summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a large volume of discovery materials. The production includes financial records from multiple banks for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as other entities and trusts. The letter outlines the confidential nature of the materials and provides technical instructions for accessing the files.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). Financial records for her and related entities are a major component of the discovery production.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Defense Request for Files
events.description: The defense sent a letter to the government specifying files they requested, which the government is now reproducing.

events.title: Major Discovery Production
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a massive volume of discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including extensive financial records.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced a vast discovery set (over 150,000 pages based on Bates numbers) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team in October 2020.
The discovery includes extensive financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities/trusts.
Related entities named in the UBS records include the Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, Ghislaine Maxwell IRA, and Ellmax, LLC.
The materials are governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and are designated as confidential.
The production also includes non-financial items such as files from 'LSJ Scene2Go' and video files, indicating a broad scope of evidence beyond just financial documents.
